depression.description: I am trying to assert financial independence but feel anxious and guilty when facing unexpected financial challenges, such as an insurance claim discrepancy.
I am determined to avoid becoming a financial burden to my parents, especially in contrast to my brother's continued dependence on them.
I feel I must handle everything independently to prove my capability as an adult.
I experience feelings of incompetence and failure when contemplating asking my parents for financial assistance.
When faced with financial difficulties, I criticize myself for not managing my finances better or anticipating problems.
I compare myself to my brother, who is financially dependent on our parents, and use this comparison to motivate my independence.
I feel tense and anxious when dealing with new adult responsibilities, such as managing health insurance and paying bills.
I sometimes act hastily or seek immediate resolutions when faced with uncertainty, as a way to reduce my anxiety.
